docs.lead_paragraph: FED PROPOSES MORTGAGE RULES The Federal Reserve proposed restrictions on exotic mortgages and high-cost loans for consumers with weak credit. New rules would force lenders to show that customers can realistically afford their mortgages. The number of groundbreakings for new homes fell 3.7 percent in November, and economists said that they expected the housing market to worsen. [C7.]

docs.lead_paragraph: A plan that would provide coverage to an estimated 70 percent of the 5.1 million persistently uninsured Californians passed the State Assembly on Monday.

headline.main: California Moves Toward Universal Health Care
headline.print_headline: California Takes Big Step Toward Universal Health Care

docs.snippet: A plan that would provide coverage to an estimated 70 percent of the 5.1 million persistently uninsured Californians passed the State Assembly on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: California moved significantly closer to enacting a broad expansion of health insurance coverage on Monday when the Democratic-controlled Assembly passed legislation that has the backing of the Republican governor, Arnold Schwarzenegger.

headline.main: California Moves Closer to Expanding Health Care
headline.print_headline: California Moves Closer to Expanding Health Care

docs.snippet: California moved significantly closer to enacting a broad expansion of health insurance coverage on Monday when the Democratic-controlled Assembly passed legislation that has the backing of the Republican governor, Arnold Schwarzenegger.
